services.title: SERVICES
services.content_infomgmt: Management and coordination of digital assets, data and consultancy on process and implementation of information management systems for hyperscale data centers, residential and specialist infrastructure.
services.content_om: Maintaining a high quality building often requires a stellar foundation of information. We manage the manual process to ensure your operations team start on steady ground.
services.content_reporting: Tracking closeout, analysis of pain points and clear, easy to digest dashboards to ensure that you have the information needed to accurately pinpoint documentation progress.

about.title: ABOUT NODEHEX
about.p1: Nodehex is an information management specialist group for hyperscale data centers and commercial builds. Our team has a wealth of experience delivering and managing documentation services across a vast number of hyperscale datacenter projects and the specialist infrastructure, offices and ancillary buildings that enable them. We simplify the process by removing the ambiguity around documentation, understanding client needs and requirements and then implementing a structure to ensure a lasting impression for information management across all mission-critical systems.
about.p2: Our services focus on providing a high quality, data driven and front-loaded effort to ensure an effective delivery from design to decommissioning. This being combined with support into the first year of operations, a smooth transition and high-quality documentation for the operations team to execute on, a facility is only as good as the information it’s supported by.

why.title: WHY NODEHEX
why.p1: Nodehex is a multi-disciplinary, multi-cultural team of information management specialists, data scientists, software developers and designers that have been working within the construction and technology industries over the last 10 years.
why.p2: Our expertise has been developed over large scale infrastructure projects, specialist hyperscale data center buildings and specialist facilities. We aim to leverage emerging technologies within the digital construction sector to extract the immense value of the data contained within projects and provide expertise consultancy on process and information management.

infomgmt.intro: Nodehex has worked within the information management sector for the last decade, covering the wide range of deliverables and expertise within the field from data quality, system implementation to large scale reporting and analytics. Our  have a multidisciplinary approach that combines digital construction expertise with data science and software development to guarantee that we deliver high quality results based on the dynamic needs of your projects.
infomgmt.cims_text: Our services focus on digital construction delivery throughout the entire lifecycle of a project, broken down into three core competencies, project initialisation, reporting and handover services.
infomgmt.pis_text: Handover is often left as a final checkbox once the final phases of construction and commissioning are nearing their completion, rather than front-loaded effort that kicks off at design. A majority of the issues during handover can often be mitigated by an experienced information management team developing the correct plans, processes and procedures, which then enables a progressive handover, rather than a massive end of project task.
infomgmt.edms_text_intro: Our team has experience of over 15 of the industry leading EDMS at an administrator and developer level, which is a critical component to any major project and effective management of digital information. Our services cover the following areas of an EDMS implementation:
infomgmt.edms_header2: Our services cover the following areas of an EDMS implementation:
infomgmt.edms_li1: Entire project level set-up and development.
infomgmt.edms_li2: Subject matter expert training, development and delivery.
infomgmt.edms_li3: Project team training based on needs/use case assessment.
infomgmt.edms_li4: Core metadata requirements for all stakeholders at multiple levels, client, contractor and sub-contractor.
infomgmt.edms_li5: Full deliverable pre-population at early project stage to enable accurate and clear reporting.
infomgmt.edms_li6: Standardised workflows based on industry best practice.
infomgmt.dmp_text_intro: Our team has experience authoring, reviewing, approving and implementing document management across largescale projects. We understand client needs, your requirements and translate them into effective processes and procedures for the execution of the project. To do this we:
infomgmt.dmp_li1: Fully authored Document Management Plan inclusive of client requirements and coordination of the review and approval process.
infomgmt.dmp_li2: Breakdown and detailing of core system set up and requirements, workflows, management requirements and handover processes within the plan.
infomgmt.dmp_li3: Provide visual workflows to convey the project processes concisely.
infomgmt.dihihc_header: Master Deliverable Index, Handover Index and Handover coordination
infomgmt.dihihc_text: Understanding delivery of information is core to holding vendors, suppliers and subcontractors accountable for handover. Getting these processes in place and executed during the early phases of the project guarantees a low-effort handover and visible accountability.
infomgmt.mitigate_text_intro: To mitigate late delivery and overdue handover risk we:
infomgmt.mitigate_li1: Initiate the Master Deliverable Index (MDI) and Handover indexes (HOI) and develop them continually as parallel actions from the outset of the project.
infomgmt.mitigate_li2: Coordinate with the subcontractors to populate and develop the MDI to ensure full visibility and understanding across the board.
infomgmt.mitigate_li3: Integrate with the commissioning teams to project and support the commissioning documentation and its handover.
infomgmt.mitigate_li4: Coordinating the handover, including tracking of all PDF and native deliverables across numerous systems and into the client's repositories.
infomgmt.reporting_link: For more of our reporting services, please navigate to our reporting and analytics service page.

om.intro: Operations and Maintenance Manuals are the cornerstone of a high-performance operations team. They’re comprehensive documents that provide all of the necessary details regarding the building systems and assets contained in those systems, within the Client’s datacenters and mission-critical infrastructure.
om.p1: Given the ever-growing scope of information management and its application in leveraging data for increased value to Design, Construction, Commissioning and Owner teams, it’s imperative to identify and more importantly, improve on data collection for operations and maintenance manuals. During a hyperscale datacenter build, the sheer amount of information produced can be staggering and finding effective ways to manage the data into handover - especially when modern hyperscale datacenter handover packages often consist of up to 50,000 documents or more - can be a challenge.
om.p2: Coordinating and staggering this information across a project takes a knowledge of the phasing for a hyperscale datacenter and ancillary buildings, such as substations and utility buildings, a deep understanding of the information lifecycle the integration of quality and project management best practices at the right times to ensure an optimal outcome.
om.h5_1: A typical O&M will include a wealth of information, typically based on systems within the building being operated, such as:
om.sysdesc_text: Design and construction intent of the system itself and the principles behind the operation of the system and the components contained therein.
om.spec_text: Client specifications and requirements detailing the specific system information that supports the overall product needs
om.dmgd_text: References and embedded information pertaining to the outputs from the Design and Construction teams at the specified level of detail by from the Client's information requirements.
om.seqops_text: Information pertaining to safe start up, systems operation within normal procedures and failsafe procedures and plant.
om.contact_link: At Nodehex, we can author, maintain and implement a variety of solutions to ensure that handover, operations and beyond, the information to operate the systems within your project can be done both safely and efficiently. Whether this is a full authoring and coordination of information across a project, consolidating and updating existing manuals or bespoke solutions for your needs, we can help.

reporting.intro: The immense value of datacenters is contained within their primary functions, the storing, processing and dissemination of data and critical applications. Where datacenters utilise data efficiently and are able to mine the value from this data, construction teams often fail to extract the complete potential of data generated during a project.
reporting.p1: While the project controls teams often excel at managing cost, commercials and schedule, and there is often some analytics focused on BIM, Quality and Documentation, the full potential of these services are never actually realised. Often projects have a bulky and manual extract, transfer and load process that doesn’t offer flexibility and real-time reporting due to tool restraints, technical restraints and general lack of expertise in data science and implementation.
reporting.p2: On any project, there are often a few systems at play that cover BIM, Quality and Documentation:
reporting.li_extranet: Cloud and extranet based folder structures, trackers, spreadsheets, etc.
reporting.p3: Our teams have the experience and expertise to leverage application programming interfaces (APIs), Extraction, Transformation and Load (ETL) processes and fully automated, live reporting to ensure that you can demonstrate where key blockers and issues can be found, plus extract the additional value from these datasets that are often left behind in most projects.
reporting.p4: On top of that, we provide compelling analytics and visualisations to ensure that the data we’ve extracted tells its story and provides clear and visible detail on where you are in the project, how your progressive handover is developing and where each detail can be found across the project data environment.
reporting.contact: For further information, please contact us and we would be happy to develop a solution that fits your needs and requirements.

privacy.p1_1: At Nodehex, accessible from https://nodehex.com, one of our main priorities is the privacy of our visitors. This Privacy Policy document contains types of information that is collected and recorded by Nodehex and how we use it.
privacy.p1_2: If you have additional questions or require more information about our Privacy Policy, do not hesitate to contact us.
privacy.p1_3: This Privacy Policy applies only to our online activities and is valid for visitors to our website with regards to the information that they shared and/or collect in Nodehex. This policy is not applicable to any information collected offline or via channels other than this website.
privacy.p2_1: By using our website, you hereby consent to our Privacy Policy and agree to its terms.
privacy.p3_1: The personal information that you are asked to provide, and the reasons why you are asked to provide it, will be made clear to you at the point we ask you to provide your personal information.
privacy.p3_2: If you contact us directly, we may receive additional information about you such as your name, email address, phone number, the contents of the message and/or attachments you may send us, and any other information you may choose to provide.
privacy.p4_1: We use the information we collect in various ways, including to:
privacy.li_1: Provide, operate, and maintain our website
privacy.li_2: Improve, personalize, and expand our website
privacy.li_3: Understand and analyze how you use our website
privacy.li_4: Develop new products, services, features, and functionality
privacy.li_5: Communicate with you, either directly or through one of our partners, including for customer service, to provide you with updates and other information relating to the website, and for marketing and promotional purposes
privacy.p5_1: Nodehex follows a standard procedure of using log files. These files log visitors when they visit websites. All hosting companies do this and a part of hosting services' analytics. The information collected by log files include internet protocol (IP) addresses, browser type, Internet Service Provider (ISP), date and time stamp, referring/exit pages, and possibly the number of clicks. These are not linked to any information that is personally identifiable. The purpose of the information is for analyzing trends, administering the site, tracking users' movement on the website, and gathering demographic information.
privacy.p6_1: Like any other website, Nodehex uses 'cookies'. These cookies are used to store information including visitors' preferences, and the pages on the website that the visitor accessed or visited. The information is used to optimize the users' experience by customizing our web page content based on visitors' browser type and/or other information.
privacy.p6_2: For more general information on cookies, please read
privacy.p6_3: more on the Cookie Consent website
privacy.p7_1: You may consult this list to find the Privacy Policy for each of the advertising partners of Nodehex.
privacy.p7_2: Third-party ad servers or ad networks uses technologies like cookies, JavaScript, or Web Beacons that are used in their respective advertisements and links that appear on Nodehex, which are sent directly to users' browser. They automatically receive your IP address when this occurs. These technologies are used to measure the effectiveness of their advertising campaigns and/or to personalize the advertising content that you see on websites that you visit.
privacy.p7_3: Note that Nodehex has no access to or control over these cookies that are used by third-party advertisers.
privacy.p8_1: Nodehex's Privacy Policy does not apply to other advertisers or websites. Thus, we are advising you to consult the respective Privacy Policies of these third-party ad servers for more detailed information. It may include their practices and instructions about how to opt-out of certain options.
privacy.p8_2: You can choose to disable cookies through your individual browser options. To know more detailed information about cookie management with specific web browsers, it can be found at the browsers' respective websites.
privacy.h2_8: CCPA Privacy Rights (Do Not Sell My Personal Information)
privacy.p9_1: Under the CCPA, among other rights, California consumers have the right to:
privacy.p9_2: Request that a business that collects a consumer's personal data disclose the categories and specific pieces of personal data that a business has collected about consumers.
privacy.p9_3: Request that a business delete any personal data about the consumer that a business has collected.
privacy.p9_4: Request that a business that sells a consumer's personal data, not sell the consumer's personal data.
privacy.p9_5: If you make a request, we have one month to respond to you. If you would like to exercise any of these rights, please contact us.
privacy.p10_1: We would like to make sure you are fully aware of all of your data protection rights. Every user is entitled to the following:
privacy.p10_2: The right to access - You have the right to request copies of your personal data. We may charge you a small fee for this service.
privacy.p10_3: The right to rectification - You have the right to request that we correct any information you believe is inaccurate. You also have the right to request that we complete the information you believe is incomplete.
privacy.p10_4: The right to erasure - You have the right to request that we erase your personal data, under certain conditions.
privacy.p10_5: The right to restrict processing - You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.
privacy.p10_6: The right to object to processing - You have the right to object to our processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.
privacy.p10_7: The right to data portability - You have the right to request that we transfer the data that we have collected to another organization, or directly to you, under certain conditions.
privacy.p10_8: If you make a request, we have one month to respond to you. If you would like to exercise any of these rights, please contact us.
privacy.p11_1: Another part of our priority is adding protection for children while using the internet. We encourage parents and guardians to observe, participate in, and/or monitor and guide their online activity.
privacy.p11_2: Nodehex does not knowingly collect any Personal Identifiable Information from children under the age of 13. If you think that your child provided this kind of information on our website, we strongly encourage you to contact us immediately and we will do our best efforts to promptly remove such information from our records.

cookies.cookies_p1: We use cookies and other tracking technologies to improve your browsing experience on our website to analyze our website traffic, and to understand where our visitors are coming from.
